stories.text:
I learned about the TN Visa recently, which allows Canadian software engineers to work in the US on a temporary basis with a non-immigrant visa.

Has anyone here applied for this visa since the pandemic began? The documentation suggests that you can arrive at a port of entry and have the visa approved there. Is that still the case?

Do you need to go through a immigration lawyer for the paperwork, or can you provide all the necessary documentation/offer of employment letter yourself?

Is it possible to receive health insurance from the company you will be working for if you are only there for 6-12 months?

Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: What is it like for Canadians to work in the US on a TN visa?
